Custom SCP Commands

Configuration of the Simulation Control Protocol (SCP) to control Vires VTD over NI VeriStand with custom commands. While common SCP commands are implemented over the SCP command channel, the user might want to issue an uncommon command as well. These commands need to be added to the following list, before the VeriStand project gets deployed. Sending the custom command is a two step process. First set the Custom SCP Command channel to the desired ID, then set the SCP Command to value 7, this will send the custom command to VIRES VTD.

What do you want to do?

Custom SCP Commands List

Custom SCP Commands List stores user-defined SCP commands which could be selected via this channel. The command ID is used on the running system for scenario selection through the Custom SCP command (value 7) of the SCP Command channel. To add a custom SCP command to this list, you need to right-click on the list and select "Add". Then give the command a descriptive name and add the complete SCP command to the Command String box. An example string can be: "<SimCtrl><Stop /></SimCtrl>" For more information on the structure and availabe SCP commands please consult the VIRES documentation under VTD/Doc/SCP_HTML/index.html. If the user enters a value higher than ID availabe the system will choose the set default value and give out error -1202 in the SCP last error channel

Note  Use right-click context menu to add or remove Scenario List items. Use up and down buttons to change scenario order (aka scenario ID). You can also import and export a command list to/from CSV, with the buttons on the top. Checking the box "Display hidden characters" will show escape sequences like "/s"
